alert.note: Alert for Hoke; Montgomery; Moore; Richmond (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 5:14PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Moore, southeastern Montgomery, northeastern Richmond and northwestern Hoke Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles south of Biscoe, or 15 miles south of Troy, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, heavy rain, and dangerous cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southern Pines, Carthage, Pinehurst, Aberdeen, Whispering Pines, Pinebluff, Ellerbe, Foxfire, Candor and Taylortown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
